content.description: This is a fun boulder problem along the left side of Pine Rock. There are a couple of ways to start, but you move up and right to top out. There is a more direct line going straight up from the start that's probably V2/V2+, but I haven't sent it yet, so I'm not going to add it here.
content.protection: 1 pad and a spotter should be good or else maybe 2 pads. There is potential for a natural toprope anchor with a long static.
content.location: Walk around the left side of Pine Rock until you reach a section of rock with a green graffiti design. Your feet start in the small cleft under the left hand side of the graffiti.

content.description: Sherrin Rocks is the first climb I've done here that feels like a "real" boulder. Heel hooks, a slight overhang, and a funky start make this problem on of the best I've found in the Urban Wild.
content.location: Start on the right hand side of The Gutter just past the scooped out middle section of the wall.

content.description: This is the hardest thing you can do in the scooped out section of The Gutter. The only thing you can consider crux-y is the second to last move, getting over to the left or right to top out.
content.location: It can be started anywhere in the scooped out section of The Gutter, but it travels up the blanker section from center to the right.

content.description: This climb can get easier if you go to the right (a pretty hard Class 4 scramble I'm calling "3-D Projector") or left (walking up the low angle slab gets you to some jugs), but Â committing to going straight up that flat section is very rewarding.
content.protection: It is protectable by a TR with a natural anchor. This is bad for pad placement because of a ledge 6 feet up.
content.location: Starts in the cleft on the left side of "The Gutter," the left face of Pine Rock. You can find The Gutter by following the trail around the left side of the Main Wall.

content.description: Downspout is a great "mind over matter" problem for beginners. A warning, this problem is named for the fact that if it's rained in the last month, this section is moist or worse.
content.protection: A natural TR anchor is possible, and there is room for pads at the base.
content.location: On the right edge of the scooped out section of "The Gutter", start in the dihedral.

content.description: The left side of Pine Rock slopes gently uphill, providing opportunity for some shorter toproped climbs and boulder problems.
